title: FS-TEL-003/PSA-TEL-PSA-TEL-006-1321/Verify postpone is not allowed for non customers for any teller transaction/Disabled
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
The system will allow the user to postpone the capture of CTR details if Customer mode was selected for a Teller transaction. Postpone will not be available if Non-Customer mode was selected for a Teller transaction.
Success Criteria: Postpone button on CTR details screen must be disabled for non customers.


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
The system will allow the user to postpone the capture of CTR details if Customer mode was selected for a Teller transaction. Postpone will not be available if Non-Customer mode was selected for a Teller transaction.
Success Criteria: Postpone button on CTR details screen must be read only for non customers.
stepAction:
<Day 0>
Product: Teller
Type of Transaction: Any
User: Authorized User
Screen:Teller Transaction Screen (Scrn No. NEWTELXYZ), Institution Parameter - Create/Amend/Inquiry (Screen 31151)      
  
    
-  'CTR Postpone Allowed' is set as 'NO' in institution parameter level create/amend/inquiry screen 31151
  
- conductor must be non customer.
  
- CTR threshold must be set at the parameter level.
Keyword/TEL/ Access to Teller Transaction Screen (Scrn No. NEWTELXYZ)
Keyword/TEL/Access to CTR Details Screen
Input the cashin/cashout amount which breaches the CTR threshold
stepResult: System must display hard stop error " Completion of CTR details is required." and CTR button must be enabled.

stepAction: Click on CTR details button
stepResult: System must navigate to CTR details screen.

stepAction: Verify "Postpone" button is read only on CTR screen
stepResult: System must display"Postpone" button as READ-ONLY when non customer is selected.

stepAction: Post condition: NA
stepResult: Clean up step

title: FS-TEL-005/PSA-TEL-001-235/Ability of system to display an alert in the IRA Contribution Transaction/Deposit to IRA Account
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
System will display all account level alerts during teller transaction. All transacting accounts involved (being debited/ credited) in the transactions will be considered to identify the alerts that need to be displayed. These will be displayed for the transaction done by the customer/non-customer.
Verify the IRA Contribution Transaction and the On-Us Check Account Number is considered to identify the alerts.
Success Criteria: System must display the linked account level alert when the user transmits the IRA Contribution Transaction/Deposit to IRA Account


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
System will display all account level alerts during teller transaction. All transacting accounts involved (being debited/ credited) in the transactions will be considered to identify the alerts that need to be displayed. These will be displayed for the transaction done by the customer/non-customer.
Verify the IRA Contribution Transaction and the On-Us Check Account Number is considered to identify the alerts.
Success Criteria: System must display the linked account level alert when the user transmits the IRA Contribution Transaction/Deposit to IRA Account
stepAction:
Product: IRA
    
Plan: Any
User: Authorized User
Screen:  IRA Contribution Transaction Screen/Transaction Authorization (Artifact#57175 Alert Details Screen/ Artifact#57177 Transaction Authorization Screen)
    
Account: Deposit IRA Account
    
      
-Conductor of the transaction must be a customer
-Alert code must be assign to Deposit IRA Account Number for  IRA Contribution Transaction
stepResult: Setup Steps

stepAction:
Keyword/TEL/Access to IRA Contribution Transaction Screen

PLACE TEXT HERE
stepResult: PLACE TEXT HERE

stepAction: Keyword/TEL/Navigate to Transaction Authorization Screen
<Day 0> Click on  "Alert Code" hyper link  in Error list subsection of the "Transaction Authorization" Screen
stepResult: System must display Account Alert details

stepAction:
Keyword/TEL/Access to Alert Code Create Screen

  
In "Sitb.testqa" environment Home Screen
stepResult: Core Home Page displayed

stepAction:
Keyword/TEL/Access to Alert Code Create Screen

Navigate into "System Maintenance-->Organization-->Institution-->Alert Codes-Create"
stepResult: Alert Codes Create Screen displayed

stepAction:
Keyword/TEL/Access to Alert Code Create Screen

  
In Alert Code Create Screen Enter following details
  
Action - C:Create (By default non-editable field)
  
Alert Code - Enter 4 digit unique alert code
  
Alert Type - Select Alert Type based upon drop down list (HST: Hard Stop,INF :Information, OVR: Override and SYS: IRA)
  
Status - Select Status as (Active/Inactive)
  
Alert Predefined Message : Enter text the alert predefined Message
  
Effective Date - Select the calendar based upon effective date set-up
  
Language Code - Select drop down list (English)
  
OLRR Search Eligibility - Select (N: No or Y: Yes)
  
Institution - Institution parameter auto populated (Based upon parameter number)
  
Select "Add Delivery Channel" or "Submit" Button
stepResult: Successfully Alert Code created for Customer OR Account level

title: FS-TEL-031/ PSA-TEL-007-1189 (PSA-DDA-002-015)/Ability of the system to validate if any of the transacting accounts is closed/ Error Message/ Debiting GL  Account/ Submit
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
The system will provide the ability to perform the following validation on the To Account number:
Account number is valid
Account is open
No posting exceptions (example: Account Dormant, Account Blocked)
Validate account status business rules
Validate customer and account level user defined alerts
Success Criteria: The system must check if the debiting GL account is an open  account that exists in the system and, if not,  display the hard stop error message "The account is closed" on the screen.


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
The system will provide the ability to perform the following validation on the To Account number:
Account number is valid
Account is open
No posting exceptions (example: Account Dormant, Account Blocked)
Validate account status business rules
Validate customer and account level user defined alerts
Success Criteria: The system must check if the debiting GL account is an open  account that exists in the system and, if not,  display the hard stop error message "The account is closed" on the screen.
stepAction:
Product: Teller
User: Authorized User
Screen: GL Debit
- Multiple types of GL Accounts from which the funds can be debited must be defined.
    
-The GL Debit  account number entered must be closed so as to trigger the error message.
stepResult: Setup Step

stepAction:
GL Debit transaction screen
    
<Day 0>Input an account number in the "GL Debit Account" field on the screen.
stepResult: System must allow the user to make an input  in the "GL Debit Account" field on the screen.

stepAction: <Day 0>Input all the other mandatory fields on the screen.
stepResult: System must allow for the user input on all the other mandatory fields.

stepAction: <Day 0> Click on the "Submit" button.
stepResult:
System must allow to submit the transaction to core and must display the following hard stop error message to the user on the screen:
  
"The account is closed"

stepAction:
Post Condition
  
NA
stepResult: Clean up Step

title: FS-TEL-003/PSA-TEL-006-1318/ Verify the system must allow the user to capture CTR information  independent of a transaction
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
The system will allow a user to capture CTR information independent of a transaction. This information will be included in the extract that is sent to the CTR system, but will not be used for CTR aggregation.
Success Criteria: User must capture CTR information independent of the transaction and it must be included  in the extract but not used for CTR aggregation


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
The system will allow a user to capture CTR information independent of a transaction. This information will be included in the extract that is sent to the CTR system, but will not be used for CTR aggregation.
Success Criteria: User must capture CTR information independent of the transaction and it must be included in the extract but not used for CTR aggregation.
stepAction:
Product: Teller
User: Authorized User
Screen:CTR Details (Screen NEWTEL19), Electronic journal
 
  
User should have the access to generate and view extract.
  
End of the day process is required.
  
    Note:CTR information will be included in the extract that is sent to the CTR system, but will not be used for CTR aggregation.
stepResult: Set up step.

                              Beneficiary (ies

stepResult: system must allow the user to submit all the details successfully.

.

title: FS-TEL-003/8.1.1/ Verify Unknown ID check box is available in beneficiary details screen/ Checked
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
The system will allow user to access the UNKNOWN ID check box in beneficiary screen
Success Criteria: User must be able check the Unknown ID check box in the beneficiary details screen for all the Non clients When checked, the system will make the following fields read only
ID Number
ID Type
ID Issuer
ID Expiration


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
The system will allow user to access the UNKNOWN ID check box in beneficiary screen
Success Criteria: User must be able check the Unknown ID check box in the beneficiary details screen for all the Non clients When checked, the system will make the following fields read only
ID Number
ID Type
ID Issuer
ID Expiration
stepAction:
Product: Teller
Type of Transaction:  Deposit
User: Authorized User
Screen: conductor/beneficiary Screen
-A transaction which invokes the CTR should be considered 
  
    
-User should have access to and able to make changes in conductor/beneficiary information screen
  
-Unknown ID field  must be displayed on the beneficiary details screen
stepResult: Set up step.

stepAction: Keyword/TEL/Navigate to CTR stand alone screen
Verify  "UNKOWN ID" checkbox is available on beneficiary details screen
stepResult: System must display UNKNOWN ID checkbox , UNCHECKED in the beneficiary details screen.

stepAction:
Verify the following fields are read only  when UNKNOWN checkbox is checked.
    
ID Number
ID Type
ID Issuer
ID Expiration
stepResult:
System must display all the below fields readonly.
  
When unchecked, the system will make the following fields optional
ID Number
ID Type
ID Issuer
ID Expiration

stepResult: System must allow the user to submit the details  successfully.

title: FS-TEL-003/3.2.1.5/View/Update CTR Details from Electronic Journal.
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
In Electronic Journal, the system will have a hyperlink in the CTR Status column to launch the CTR Details screen from the Electronic Journal. 
Any authorized user will be able to capture/update CTR details by invoking the CTR Details screen from this hyperlink.
Success criteria: User must have access to the hyperlink (Captured/postponed)and view or update the CTR details.


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
In Electronic Journal, the system will have a hyperlink in the CTR Status column to launch the CTR Details screen from the Electronic Journal. 
Any authorized user will be able to capture/update CTR details by invoking the CTR Details screen from this hyperlink.
Success criteria: User must have access to the hyperlink (Captured/postponed)and view or update the CTR details .
stepAction:
Product: Teller
Type of Transaction:  Any
User: Authorized User
Screen: Electronic Journal (Screen 9567)
    
-A Transaction which invokes the CTR should be considered.
stepResult: Set up step.

stepAction:
Keyword/TEL/Navigate to the Electronic Journal Screen

.
<Day 0>Verify CTR status field on Electronic journal inquiry screen
stepResult:
System must display CTR status field with following values:
    
C: Captured,
 P:Postponed,
 N:NA

stepAction: <Day 0>Select CTR status as "Captured" from the drop down.
stepResult: System must display results as per the filter criteria and must display only CTR transactions which are  "captured".

stepAction: <Day 0>Click on the "Captured" hyperlink on CTR status column in the result section of electronic journal.
stepResult: System must navigate to CTR screen with all the details pre-populated.

stepAction: <Day 0>Verify user can modify some fields in CTR details screen and click on submit.
stepResult: System must allow the user to update the details .

stepAction: <Day 0>Select CTR status as "Postpone" from the drop down.
stepResult: System must display results as per the filter criteria and display only CTR transactions which are  "postponed".

stepAction: <Day 0>Click on the "Postpone" hyperlink on CTR status column in the result section of electronic journal.
stepResult: System must navigate to CTR screen with no details.

stepAction: <Day 0>Verify user must enter the details  in CTR details screen and click on submit.
stepResult: System must allow the user to update the details .

title: FS-TEL-005/PSA-TEL-001-235/Ability of system to display an alert in the Deposit Transaction/Deposit to Account
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
System will display all account level alerts during teller transaction. All transacting accounts involved (being debited/ credited) in the transactions will be considered to identify the alerts that need to be displayed. These will be displayed for the transaction done by the customer/non-customer.
On the Teller Transaction system must display the Alert that has been linked to the account, Verify if the system displays the Account level Alert.

Success Criteria: System must display the linked account level alert when the user transmits the Deposit to Account


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
System will display all account level alerts during teller transaction. All transacting accounts involved (being debited/ credited) in the transactions will be considered to identify the alerts that need to be displayed. These will be displayed for the transaction done by the customer/non-customer.
On the Teller Transaction system must display the Alert that has been linked to the account, Verify if the system displays the Account level Alert.

Success Criteria: System must display the linked account level alert when the user transmits the Deposit to Account
stepAction:

User: Authorized User
Screen:  Deposit Transaction/Transaction Authorization (Artifact#57175 Alert Details Screen/ Artifact#57177 Transaction Authorization Screen) 
      
-Conductor of the transaction must be a customer
      
-The Alerts for Deposit to account in the Deposit Transaction must be set-up at the Institution level parameter
      
-Alert code must be assign to Deposit to Account for Deposit Transaction

title: FS-DDA-016/PSA-DDA-007-039e/During creation of manual hold, system does not allow the Court Order Receipt Date to be future dated
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
During creation of a manual hold, the system must not allow future dates for Court Order Receipt Date when Hold Category is a "Legal" hold type. If future dated, system throws the following error: "Court Order Date cannot be a future date".
Note: MM/DD/CCYY.
Success Criteria: During creation of a manual hold, the system will not have allowed the Court Order Receipt Date to be future dated when hold category is of a legal hold type. If future dated, system throws the following error: "Court Order Date cannot be a future date".


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
During creation of a manual hold, the system must not allow future dates for Court Order Receipt Date when Hold Category is a "Legal" hold type. If future dated, system throws the following error: "Court Order Date cannot be a future date".
Success Criteria: During creation of a manual hold, the system will not have allowed the Court Order Receipt Date to be future dated when hold category is of a legal hold type. If future dated, system throws the following error: "Court Order Date cannot be a future date".
stepAction:
Product: Any
User: Authorized User
Screen: Hold Creation (009093)
Involvement: Court Order Receipt Date
-Hold type is legal
stepResult: Set up step.

stepAction:
Keyword/DDA/Access to Set Hold Screen (009093).

Navigation still under contruction
stepResult:
System will have displayed the Hold Creation Screen (009093)
  
-Choosing the Hold Type will make certain fields appear or disappear based on requirements.

stepAction:
<Day 0>
  
Select hold type ="Legal"-> Hold sub type ="Any" from the dropdown option ->Enter the hold amount -> Enter expiration date as a future date ->Enter Court Order date as a future date -> Click on submit button.
stepResult: Verification: System must display an error message "Court Order Date cannot be a future date".

stepAction: Post condition: N/A
stepResult: Clean up step.

title: FS-DDA-016/PSA-DDA-007-039f/Funds made available on the next business day after expiration date; status changes to Expired
stepAction:
Product: Any
User: Authorized User
Screen: Hold Creation (009093)
Involvement: Funds availability
    
-Verify that the available balance is in the positive (enough funds to handle various holds for testing)
    
-Create at least one hold of each Hold Type for the account (Legal, Admin, Collateral). Make sure that these holds will automatically expire upon next EOD
    
-Ensure that the available balance decreases by the hold amounts and the Holds Balance Increases from Legal and Admin... and Total Hold Balance increases by the Legal, Admin, and Collateral amounts.
stepResult: Set up step.

stepAction:
Keyword/DDA/Navigate to Account Short Inquiry Screen (032000)

  
Click on "Inquiry" > Click on "Account Inquiry"
stepResult: System will have displayed the "Account Inquiry" Screen (032000)

stepAction:
<Day 0>
  
Verify following fields
  
Available balance
  
Hold Balance
  
Total Hold Balance
stepResult: Notate the balances in preparation for EOD

stepAction: Run the EOD
stepResult: EOD must be successful.

stepAction:
Keyword/DDA/Navigate to Account Short Inquiry Screen (032000)

  
Click on "Inquiry" > Click on "Account Inquiry"
stepResult: System will have displayed the "Account Inquiry" Screen (032000)

stepAction:
Verify following fields
    
Available balance
    
Hold Balance
    
Total Hold Balance
stepResult:
Hold balance and Total hold balance must get decreased by hold amount.
  
Available balance must get increased by hold amount.

stepAction:
Keyword/DDA/Navigate to Hold Summary Inquiry (NEWDDA7) from Hold Create (009093)Screen.

Click on Inquiry > Click on Hold Inquiry
stepResult:
System will have displayed the "Hold Summary Inquiry" screen
  
Search Criteria screen is on top with Hold Category defaulted to "ALL"

stepAction: <Day 0>Verify the status of the hold
stepResult: The Status must have changed to Expired

title: FS-DDA-018/3.2.1.2/Holds expire after the the EOD which affects the balances and status
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
Hold Transactions become expired after the EOD, which must have the following effects:
A) The Available Balance must INCREASE by the hold amount. 
B) The Total Hold Balance must DECREASE by the hold amount.
C) Hold must retain the new Status of "Expired".
Success Criteria: Hold Transactions become expired after the EOD, which must have the following effects:
A) The Available Balance must INCREASE by the hold amount. 
B) The Total Hold Balance must DECREASE by the hold amount.
C) Hold must retain the new Status of "Expired".

Hold Transactions become expired after the EOD, which must have the following effects:
A) The Available Balance must INCREASE by the hold amount. 
B) The Total Hold Balance must DECREASE by the hold amount.
C) Hold must retain the new Status of "Expired".

title: FS-TEL-005/PSA-TEL-001-235/Ability of system to display an alert in the GL Debit/Deposit to Account Transaction
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
System will display all account level alerts during teller transaction. All transacting accounts involved (being debited/ credited) in the transactions will be considered to identify the alerts that need to be displayed. These will be displayed for the transaction done by the customer/non-customer.
On the Teller Transaction system must display the Alert that has been linked to the account, Verify if the system displays the Account level Alert.

Success Criteria: System must display the linked account level alert when the user transmits the GL Debit/Deposit to Account Transaction


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
System will display all account level alerts during teller transaction. All transacting accounts involved (being debited/ credited) in the transactions will be considered to identify the alerts that need to be displayed. These will be displayed for the transaction done by the customer/non-customer.
On the Teller Transaction system must display the Alert that has been linked to the account, Verify if the system displays the Account level Alert.

Success Criteria: System must display the linked account level alert when the user transmits the GL Debit/Deposit to Account Transaction
stepAction:
Product: Any
User: Authorized User
Screen: GL Debit Transaction/Transaction Authorization 
(Artifact#57175 Alert Details Screen/ Artifact#57177 Transaction Authorization Screen)
      
Account: Deposit to Account
      
-Conductor of the transaction must be a customer
-All the Alerts for Deposit from account in the GL Debit Transaction must be set-up at the Institution level parameter
      
-Alert code must be assign Deposit to Account  for GL Debit Transaction
stepResult: Set up steps

RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
For identified transactions, when customer is selected (based on customer/non-customer indicator selected), the system will inquire the following 3 fields setup on the primary customer's record, on tab out of the crediting/debiting/reference account number field.
1. VIP Service Group
2. Service Organization
3. Un-deliverable mail indicator for primary physical address.

Success Criteria: System must display Client code Inquiry "For Account (XXXXXXXXXXXXX) Undeliverable Mail = 1 Returned Mail" Notification message on IRA Contribution Transaction Screen.


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
For identified transactions, when customer is selected (based on customer/non-customer indicator selected), the system will inquire the following 3 fields setup on the primary customer's record, on tab out of the crediting/debiting/reference account number field.
1. VIP Service Group
2. Service Organization
3. Un-deliverable mail indicator for primary physical address.

Success Criteria: System must display Client code Inquiry "For Account (XXXXXXXXXXXXX) Undeliverable Mail = 1 Returned Mail" Notification message on IRA Contribution Transaction Screen.
stepAction:
Product: IRA
    
Plan: Any
    
User: Authorized User
Screen:  IRA Contribution Transaction Screen (Artifact#189214
    
-Conductor of the transaction must be a customer
    
-Set up Condition for Payee/Reference Account as "Undeliverable Mail = 1 Returned Mail" client code Inquiry message at Parameter level
stepResult: Setup Step

title: FS-TEL-005/3.2.3.1/Verify Hard Stop or OK message display/client code notification reset when user tabs out of another acount filed on IRA Contribution Transaction Screen
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
For transactions identified in Appendix 2, the system will run Client Code Inquiry Validations only when  a.Customer is selected (based on customer/non-customer indicator selected)
b.User tabs out of an account field identified for corresponding teller transaction listed in Appendix 2.
2.As part of the Client Code Inquiry validations, the system will inquire the following fields present at the primary customer level of the accounts identified for respective teller transactions in Appendix 2. 
a.VIP Service Group
▪ If a value is present in this field a notification will be presented.
The section within the Teller transaction screen in which the Client Code notification will be displayed is indicated in section 4.1. This notification will be reset when user tabs out of another account field mentioned in Appendix 2 or when the system encounters a Hard Stop or OK message.
Success Criteria: System must display Hard Stop or OK message when user tab out of another account field on IRA Contribution Transaction Screen


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
For transactions identified in Appendix 2, the system will run Client Code Inquiry Validations only when  a.Customer is selected (based on customer/non-customer indicator selected)
b.User tabs out of an account field identified for corresponding teller transaction listed in Appendix 2.
2.As part of the Client Code Inquiry validations, the system will inquire the following fields present at the primary customer level of the accounts identified for respective teller transactions in Appendix 2. 
a.VIP Service Group
▪ If a value is present in this field a notification will be presented.
The section within the Teller transaction screen in which the Client Code notification will be displayed is indicated in section 4.1. This notification will be reset when user tabs out of another account field mentioned in Appendix 2 or when the system encounters a Hard Stop or OK message.
Success Criteria: System must display Hard Stop or OK message when user tab out of another account field on IRA Contribution Transaction Screen
stepAction:
Product: Any
User: Authorized User
Screen: IRA Contribution Transaction
-Conductor of the transaction must be a customer
-Set up Condition for Account as "Undeliverable Mail = 1 Returned Mail" client code Inquiry message
-System must present at the primary customer level of the account for respective IRA Contribution Transaction
stepResult: Setup Step

title: FS-TEL-005/3.2.2.2/Verify Deposit correction transaction involve in Branch Hopping Cash Aggregation/system must mark the record as deleted and not considered Branch Hopping aggregation validation
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
5.On successful Correction of a transaction which involved Branch Hopping Cash Aggregation, the system will mark the record as deleted and will not be considered for Branch Hopping Aggregation purposes.

Success Criteria: system must mark the record as deleted and not considered Branch Hopping aggregation validation for Deposit Correction Transaction


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
5.On successful Correction of a transaction which involved Branch Hopping Cash Aggregation, the system will mark the record as deleted and will not be considered for Branch Hopping Aggregation purposes.

Success Criteria: system must mark the record as deleted and not considered Branch Hopping aggregation validation for Deposit Correction Transaction
stepAction:

title: FS-TEL-005/PSA-TEL-002-759/Verify Branch Hopping Validation for Deposit transaction involving Check-in-Transit and Cash Out
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
The system will run the Branch Hopping validations only :
- For identified transactions in which both transit checks are presented and cash is disbursed and
- When the conductor is a Customer (identified using the customer / non customer flag)
Verify the customer/account doing Deposit transactions, Enter the amount in Threshold field. Based upon the parameter user will get the alert.
Success Criteria: System must allow posting transactions and the system will record the transaction cash-out amount


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
The system will run the Branch Hopping validations only :
- For identified transactions in which both transit checks are presented and cash is disbursed and
- When the conductor is a Customer (identified using the customer / non customer flag)

Success Criteria: The system must not display Branch hopping suspect alert on the screen
stepAction:
Product: Any
User: Authorized User
Screen: Deposit Transaction Screen
    
      
-Conductor of the transaction must be a customer
-The parameter value of Branch Hopping Number of Business Days must be set to  "1.Current business day" at Institution level
-The Branch Hopping Cash out Threshold value must be set at the Institution level parameter
    
-Business days for branch hopping will be based on the Federal Clearing Calendar (as is being defined in DDA work stream)
stepResult: Setup Step

stepAction: Keyword/TEL/Access the Deposit Transaction Screen
<Day 0>Enter the  "Check in -Transit" (non-zero value) Information in Check in - Transit field
stepResult: System must accept the "Check in - Transit" on Deposit Transaction screen

stepAction: <Day 0>Enter the  "Cash-Out" Amount (non-zero value) in Cash-Out field
stepResult: System must accept the "Cash-Out" Amount on Deposit Transaction Screen

stepAction: <Day 0> Enter Customer ID Type-->ID Issuer-->ID Number-->ID Expiration Date--> Click on "Submit" button
stepResult: System must not display Branch hopping suspect alert

title: FS-TEL-005/PSA-TEL-005-1073/Verify Branch Hopping Aggregation Validation for Same payee/Reference Account and First ID Captured
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
Customer conduct 4 transactions involving cash out during the day
-Cashing Transit Check for $200.00, no alert to the user, aggregation occurs on $200.00 cash out leaving $300.00 remaining on Payee/Reference Account and Customer  ID
-Depositing (with either deposit or deferred transaction) $150 and cashing $50.00 from a $200 Transit Check, no alert to the user, aggregation occurs on $50.00 cash out leaving $250.00 remaining on payee/reference account and customer ID 
-Cashing Transit Check for $250.00, no alert to the user, aggregation occurs on $250.00 cash out leaving $0.00 remaining on payee/reference account and Customer ID
-Depositing $100.00 and cashing $200.00 from a $300.00 Transit Check, alert to the user occurs and override needed as aggregation has now been breached by $200.00 on Account payee/reference and customer ID 
Success Criteria: System must allow Aggregate cash out transactions when a transit check is involved based off of payee/reference account number and First ID captured.


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
Customer conduct 4 transactions involving cash out during the day
-Cashing Transit Check for $200.00, no alert to the user, aggregation occurs on $200.00 cash out leaving $300.00 remaining on Payee/Reference Account and Customer  ID
-Depositing (with either deposit or deferred transaction) $150 and cashing $50.00 from a $200 Transit Check, no alert to the user, aggregation occurs on $50.00 cash out leaving $250.00 remaining on payee/reference account and customer ID 
-Cashing Transit Check for $250.00, no alert to the user, aggregation occurs on $250.00 cash out leaving $0.00 remaining on payee/reference account and Customer ID
-Depositing $100.00 and cashing $200.00 from a $300.00 Transit Check, alert to the user occurs and override needed as aggregation has now been breached by $200.00 on Account payee/reference and customer ID 
Success Criteria: System must allow Aggregate cash out transactions when a transit check is involved based off of payee/reference account number and First ID captured.
stepAction:
Product: Any
User: Authorized User
Screen: Check Cashing Transaction Screen
    
      
-Conductor of the transaction must be a customer
-The parameter value of Branch Hopping Number of Business Days must be set to  "1.Current business day" at Institution level
    
-Business days for branch hopping will be based on the Federal Clearing Calendar (as is being defined in DDA work stream)
-The Branch Hopping Cash out Threshold value must be set ($500) at the Institution level parameter
    
-Aggregate Cash Out transactions when a transit check is involved based off of payee/ Reference Account Number and First ID captured
stepResult: Setup Step

stepAction: Keyword/TEL/Access to Check Cashing Transaction Screen
<Day 0> Enter Transit Check of $200.00 on Transit-Check Field
stepResult: System must accept the "Check in - Transit"

stepAction: <Day 0> Enter Cash-Out Amount $200 in Cash-Out Field
stepResult: System must accept the "Cash-Out" Amount

stepAction: <Day 0> Enter payee/Reference Account Number---> Customer ID Type-->ID Issuer-->ID Number-->ID Expiration Date--> Click on  "Submit" Button
stepResult: System must not display Branch Hopping Alert because of $300.00 remaining on Payee/Reference Account

<Day 0>  User Navigate back into Deposit Transaction
  
Enter Transit Check of $200.00 on Transit-Check Field
stepResult: System must accept the "Check in - Transit"

stepAction: <Day 0>  Enter Cash Out Amount $50.00 in Cash-Out Field
stepResult: System must accept the "Cash-Out" Amount

stepAction: <Day 0> Enter payee/Reference Account Number---> Customer ID Type-->ID Issuer-->ID Number-->ID Expiration Date--> Click on  "Submit" Button
stepResult: System must not display Branch Hopping  Alert , Aggregation occurs on $50.00

stepAction:
User Navigate back into Deposit Transaction
  
<Day 0> Enter Transit Check of $250.00 on Transit-Check Field
stepResult: System must accept the "Check in - Transit"

stepAction: <Day 0> Enter Cash Out Amount $0.00 in Cash-Out Field
stepResult: System must accept the "Cash-Out" Amount

stepAction: <Day 0> Enter payee/Reference Account Number---> Customer ID Type-->ID Issuer-->ID Number-->ID Expiration Date--> Click on  "Submit" Button
stepResult: System must not display Alert , Aggregation occurs on $250.00

stepAction: <Day 0> Enter Transit Check of $100.00 on Transit-Check Field
stepResult: System must accept the "Check in - Transit"

stepAction: <Day 0> Enter Cash Out Amount $200.00 in Cash-Out Field
stepResult: System must accept the "Cash-Out" Amount

stepAction:
<Day 0> Navigate back to Deposit Transaction Screen
    
 Enter payee/Reference Account Number---> Customer ID Type-->ID Issuer-->ID Number-->ID Expiration Date--> Click on  "Submit" Button
stepResult: System must display suspect alert  Aggregation has now been breached by $200.00 on Payee/Reference Account and Customer ID

title: FS-TEL-024/PSA-TEL-003-840/Ability of system support to making a regular contribution/deposit to Roth IRA account
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
The system will support the ability to make deposit to an IRA account as a regular contribution, to the following types:
-Roth
-Traditional
-Coverdell ESA (Educational IRA)
-SEP
Types of IRA's offered to be configurable by affiliate.
Success Criteria : System must support to deposit to an IRA Account as regular contribution of Roth


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
The system will support the ability to make deposit to an IRA account as a regular contribution, to the following types:
-Roth
-Traditional
-Coverdell ESA (Educational IRA)
-SEP
Types of IRA's offered to be configurable by affiliate.
Success Criteria : System must support to deposit to an IRA Account as regular contribution of Roth
stepAction:
Customer : Any
Product : IRA
Plan : Roth
Account : Internal Deposit Account
Screen : IRA Contribution/Transaction Inquiry 
  
To execute to this test case deposit to Roth IRA Account from DEP  Account  Amount for example $100.00 to an IRA Account
  
Assumption: Type of IRA configuration per affiliate is as defined in TD work stream
  
-At institution parameter, the account to which funds is transferred must be set to "Roth IRA" type.
stepResult: Setup Step

stepAction:
Keyword/IRA/Access to IRA Contribution Screen

<Day 0>
Click Transactions from the left navigation panel>Click on IRA Contribution
stepResult: IRA Contribution Screen must be displayed

stepAction: <Day 0> Enter Valid Roth IRA Account Number--> Select the "Contribution Type" as "Regular"--> Select the "Contribution Year" as "Current Year"--> Select the drop down type as "DEP"  withdrawal section--> Enter Valid Internal Deposit Account Number-->Fill all other mandatory fields ---> Click on "Submit" button
stepResult: User must be able to transfer funds from the "DEP Internal account" TO "Roth IRA" account

              Net Deposit Amount = Cash In + Checks In (on-us & transit) + Withdraw From Amount – Cash Out               and the calculated value  is greater than zero.

description:

The System will allow the standard fields for customer identification document capture.
The name of the person performing the transaction they system will require the following ID Details to be entered for a customer receiving cash. ID Type - The Type of ID being used by the person performing the transaction
ID Issuer - The Authority issuing the ID
ID Number - The ID Number of the ID type being used by the person performing the transaction
Success Criteria : System must allow to capture the identification details of the customer by providing standard fields on the IRA Contribution Transaction Screen

ID Number - The ID Number of the ID type being used by the person performing the transaction

title: FS-TEL-024/PSA-TEL-003-847/Ability of the system to allow user for a IRA Contribution correction transaction, provided the original transaction is executed earlier on the same day
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
The system will provide the ability to correct an IRA Contribution Transaction, available on the same day for teller users. As part of the correction, the posting conditions for the accounts involved in the transaction need to be validated again.
Success Criteria : The system must allow to correct the IRA Contribution Transaction when the original transaction was  executed earlier during the same business day.


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
The system will provide the ability to correct an IRA Contribution Transaction, available on the same day for teller users. As part of the correction, the posting conditions for the accounts involved in the transaction need to be validated again.
Success Criteria : The system must allow to correct the IRA Contribution Transaction when the original transaction was  executed earlier during the same business day.
stepAction:
User :  Authorized User
    
Customer : Any
Product : IRA
Plan : Traditional
Screen : IRA Contribution Correction
    
      
-A correction  transaction must be present. 
-The original advance transaction must take have taken place on the same business day.
-The user must have access to the electronic journal screen.
stepResult: Setup Step

stepAction:
<Day 0> Access the electronic journal
  
Teller-->click on Electronic Journal
stepResult: Electronic Journal screen must be displayed

stepAction: <Day 0> Verify that  the "Correction" hyperlink is present under the Correction column in the Results grid against the displayed IRA Contribution transaction record.
stepResult: System must display the  "Correction" hyperlink under the Correction column in the Results grid against the displayed transaction record.

stepAction: <Day 0> Click on the "Correction" hyperlink.
stepResult: System must allow the user to click on the correction hyperlink and must launch the IRA Contribution Correction Transaction screen.

stepAction:
<Day 0> Verify on the IRA Contribution Correction Transaction Screen, all the fields are non-editable and auto populated with the values of the original transaction, except the following two fields:
  
- Receipt Option (default:None)
  
- Display Balance on Receipt (Yes)
stepResult:
System must launch the IRA Contribution Correction Transaction Screen with all the fields  non-editable and auto populated with the values of the original transaction, except the following two fields: 
- Receipt Option (default:None)
    
- Display Balance on Receipt (Yes)

stepAction: <Day 0> Click on the "Submit" button on the IRA Contribution Correction Transaction Screen.
stepResult: System must allow the user to click on the "Submit" button and must commit the correction transaction successfully.

stepAction:
<Day 0> Access the electronic journal
  
Teller-->click on Electronic Journal
stepResult: Electronic Journal screen must be displayed

stepAction: <Day 0> Verify that  the "Correction" hyperlink is not present anymore under the Correction column in the Results grid against the original  transaction record.
stepResult: System must remove the correction hyperlink against the original transaction record once the correction transaction is successfully posted.

title: FS-TEL-024/PSA-TEL-006-1303/Ability of the system to generate a receipt/ IRA Contribution Transaction
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
The system will be able generate a receipt for the account credited within the IRA Contribution transaction:
-Branch Number
-Transaction Date (MM/DD/YYYY)
-Transaction Time (HH:MM:SS - Military format)
-Reprint (if applicable, else leave blank)
-Operator (Teller ID show last 3 numbers, ex. XXXX123)
-Journal Number
-Reversal Transaction Receipt Printing with an indicator if applicable
-Transaction Description
-Product (ex DDA, Sav)
-Transaction Amount per deposit account
-Credit Account Number (masked only show last 4 ex XXXXXXXXXXXX1234)
-Marketing Message
-Operator : First Name of Operator (optional print or not print at affiliate level)
-Current Balance
-Cash In
-Cash Out

title: FS-TD-001/3.1.3/Ability to support "Fixed Term" term deposits through Min-Term and Max-Term parameters at product level/Positive
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
System must have ability to support "Fixed Term" term deposits through “Minimum Term” and “Maximum Term” parameters at product level.
Explanation: If Min and Max term is same then the product considers Fixed Term product. (E.g Minimum term length= 6 months and maximum term length= 6 months)
Success Criteria : System has the ability to support "Fixed Term" term deposits through “Minimum Term” and “Maximum Term” parameters at product level.


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
System must have ability to support "Fixed Term" term deposits through “Minimum Term” and “Maximum Term” parameters at product level.
Explanation: If Min and Max term is same then the product considers Fixed Term product. (E.g Minimum term length= 6 months and maximum term length= 6 months)
Success Criteria : System has the ability to support "Fixed Term" term deposits through “Minimum Term” and “Maximum Term” parameters at product level.

Minimum and Maximum term length is set up same for both for example 6 months in both
    
All other mandatory fields are entered by the user

title: FS-TD-003/PSA-TD-003-001/Validate  that the ability for a user to set  up to 99 penalty routine tiers.
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
At the parameter level, user must have the ability to set up upto 99 peranlty routine tiers based on the term and frequency of the CD.
Example: CD Terms zero to 12 months may require a 30 day penalty. Terms 12 months to 2 years may require a 3 month penalty. Terms 2 years to 5 years may require a 6 month penalty.
Note: The penalty routine will have period in days or months.
Success Criteria: Users sets up 99 penalty routine tiers.


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
At the parameter level, user must have the ability to set up upto 99 peranlty routine tiers based on the term and frequency of the CD.
Example: CD Terms zero to 12 months may require a 30 day penalty. Terms 12 months to 2 years may require a 3 month penalty. Terms 2 years to 5 years may require a 6 month penalty.
Note: The penalty routine will have period in days or months.
Success Criteria: Users sets up 99 penalty routine tiers.

User: Authorized
Screen: Penalty Routine Code Set Up Screen
stepResult: Set Up Step

stepResult: At the parameter level, user must have the ability to set up upto 99 peranlty routine tiers based on the term and frequency of the CD.

title: FS-TD-003/PSA-TD-003-014/Validate that the system accumulates and displays the penalty(ies) for current year in the Penalty YTD field.
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
System must have the ability to display the penalty for current year in the Penalty YTD field. Hence this is being tested.
This new field is used to track the total penalty applied on the term deposit account in the current financial year. It will get updated when penalty transaction is performed on the account. It will get reduced when penalty refund transaction is performed
This information will be available for inquiry in the account inquiry screen
Success Criteria: System must displays the penalty for current year in the Penalty YTD field.


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
System must have the ability to display the penalty for current year in the Penalty YTD field. Hence this is being tested.
This new field is used to track the total penalty applied on the term deposit account in the current financial year. It will get updated when penalty transaction is performed on the account. It will get reduced when penalty refund transaction is performed
This information will be available for inquiry in the account inquiry screen
Success Criteria: System must displays the penalty for current year in the Penalty YTD field.

Account which has been charged some penlaties on it in the current year

title: FS-TD-003/PSA-TD-003-086/Validate that system derives penalty as zero for partial withdrawal within grace period.
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
At the account level, when a partial withdrawal is made within the grace period the system must derive a penalty amount as Zero. 
Success Criteria: Penalty Amount is zero.


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
At the account level, when a partial withdrawal is made within the grace period the system must derive a penalty amount as Zero. 
CD.Penalty Amount = (Amount x Number of penalty days x Interest Rate) / 365 this formula is being used to calculate the penalty. Calculated Penalty amount would be {Penalty Amount = (50,000 x 60 x 0.01) / 365 = $82.19.}.
Success Criteria: Penalty Amount is zero.
stepAction:
Product: TD/CD
User: System
Screen: TD Partial Redemption Screen, Transaction Inquiry Screen
    
-The CD account must not have reached maturity.
-Account must be in the grace days
    
CD Penalty Amount = (Amount x Number of penalty days x Interest Rate) / 365 this formula is being used to calculate the penalty.
    
Calculated Penalty amount would be {Penalty Amount = (50,000 x 60 x 0.01) / 365 = $82.19
    
-Penalty routine code must be attached
stepResult: Set Up Step

at the account level, at the time of full redemption the system must automatically change the Add Accrued interest option to Y and must capitalize the same if the value in the “Outstanding Checks” field is greater than zero.
Success Criteria: system changes the add accrued interest to Y automatically and does not allow a user to change it to "No".


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
At the account level, at the time of full redemption the system must automatically change the Add Accrued interest option to Y and must capitalize the same if the value in the “Outstanding Checks” field is greater than zero.

title: FS-TD-003/3.2.6/Redemption transactions where penalty is waived must be recorded in the transaction history as non financial transactions.
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
For redemption transactions where the penalty has been waived, no credit or debit regarding the penalty will post to the Term Deposit account.  However, this will be shown as a non-financial transaction in the transaction history relating to the term deposit account, which will not impact the current balance of the account.
Success Criteria: No debit or credit posted to the TD account. but it is recorded in the transaction history and current balance did not change.


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
For redemption transactions where the penalty has been waived, no credit or debit regarding the penalty will post to the Term Deposit account.  However, this will be shown as a non-financial transaction in the transaction history relating to the term deposit account, which will not impact the current balance of the account.
Success Criteria: No debit or credit posted to the TD account. but it is recorded in the transaction history and current balance did not change.

User: System

-Interest penalty days: 60 days
    
-Current balance must be more than $50,000
    
-Penalty Calculation method must be defined as Simple at the Product Level
-Penalty routine code must be attached
    
CD.Penalty Amount = (Amount x Number of penalty days x Interest Rate) / 365 this formula is being used to calculate the penalty.
    
Penalty Amount = (50,000 x 60 x 0.01) / 365 = $82.19.

title: FS-TD-004/PSA-TD-003-041/System must restrict the users from entering interest rate below the minimum rate defined at product level-For Fixed Rate.
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
At an account level, the system must restrict a user to enter an interest rate that is below the minimum rate defined at the product level.
Success Criteria: The system restricts a user from entering an interest rate that is below the minimum interest rate defined at the product level.
Notes: Example: Product Parameters: Min Rate Variance = 2.500%
At account level, user can input a rate only above 2.500%


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
At an account level, the system must restrict a user to enter an interest rate that is below the minimum rate defined at the product level.
Success Criteria: The system restricts a user from entering an interest rate that is below the minimum interest rate defined at the product level.
Notes: Example: Min Rate Variance = 0.750%
Product Rate = 1.200%

-Vary Interest Rate is set as "Yes".
      
Example:
    
Min Rate Variance = 0.750%
    
Product Rate = 1.200%

title: FS-TD-004/PSA-TD-050/System must have the ability to change(Decrease) the Fixed Interest rate at the account level.
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
The system must provide the ability to the user to change(Decrease) the Fixed interest rate at the account level. The capability level of the authorized user may differ by affiliate.
Success Criteria: System allows to change(Decrease) the Fixed interest rate at the account level.


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
The system must provide the ability to the user to change(Decrease) the Fixed interest rate at the account level. The capability level of the authorized user may differ by affiliate.
Success Criteria: System allows to change(Decrease) the Fixed interest rate at the account level.
stepAction:
Precondition
Product: CD
User: Authorized user
Screen: TD Change Rate Details Screen
    
-Rate Type is already set to the Fixed at the Account Level
-The account should have inherited the product level value of interest rate
-User must have the required capability level.
    
"Vary Account Rate" flag at the product level set to "Yes"
stepResult: Set up step

stepAction:
Keyword/TD/Access the TD Change Rate Details Screen

  
<Day 0>
  
Go to Customer Services > Customer Search > Accounts > Maintenance(Left navigation panel) > Change Rate Details
stepResult: system displays the change rate details screen

stepAction:
<Day 0>
    
Select the option "Fixed" from the drop down field "Rate Change Type"
    
->Enter the new interest rate in the "New Rate" field. (This rate must be lower than the value in the "Effective Rate" field which defines the existing rate on the account)
-> Enter all the Remaining mandatory fields
-> Click on "Submit " button
stepResult: System must ask for a supervisor override

stepAction: Supervisor overrides the transaction
stepResult: System must allow the change in rate with supervisor override  (as entered in  step 3)

stepAction:
Keyword/TD/Navigate to the TD Account Inquiry Screen

  
    
<Day 0> 
    
Click Inquiry from the left navigation panel > Click on Account Inquiry
stepResult: System displays account inquiry screen

stepAction:
<Day 0>
    
Go to the "Interest" section
 ->Verify if the "Effective Interest Rate" field reflects the changes made to the interest rate.(as entered in step 3)
stepResult: System must display the changed interest rate ( as entered in step 3 )

stepAction:
<Day 0>
  
 
  
Navigate to Tanscation Inquiry screen.
    
Enter "From Date" and "To Date" (including the date of rate change)
-> Click on "Submit" button
stepResult: System must Display all the Transactions as per search criteria.

stepAction:
<Day 0>
Verify that the system displays an entry for change of rate with effective date of change  in the Transaction History
stepResult: The system  must display an entry for change of rate with effective date of change  in the Transaction History

stepAction:
Post Condition:
  
NA
stepResult: Clean Up Step

title: FS-TD-004/PSA-TD-003-021/System must not allow a user to change the rate at Account Create screen, if at the product level "Rate Type" is selected as Variable.
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
At the account opening system must validate if at the product level the rate is set to variable rate, if yes it is set to variable rate then the system must not capture absolute rate and system must display a hard stop error. Because "New Rate" field at the Account Create screen is default set to the Fixed Rate.
Success Criteria: System does not capture absolute rate at the account level as the product is defined to have variable rate and system displays a hard stop error.


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
At the account opening system must validate if at the product level the rate is set to variable rate, if yes it is set to variable rate then the system must not capture absolute rate and system must display a hard stop error. Because "New Rate" field at the Account Create screen is default set to the Fixed Rate.
Success Criteria: System does not capture absolute rate at the account level as the product is defined to have variable rate and system displays a hard stop error.
stepAction:
Pre condition
Product: CD

title: FS-TD-005/PSA-TD-002-017/Ability to define interest payout instructions and final payout instructions separately-Payement Selected-Pay By Check/Positive
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
System must be able to define interest payout instructions and principal payout/final payout  separately "Payment Method selected as Pay By Check" at the maturity of the CD account. System must generate checks for Interest and Principal.
Success Criteria: System must allows a user to define interest payout instructions and principal payout/final payout  separately at the maturity of the CD account and generates checks at the Maturity.


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
System must be able to define interest payout instructions and principal payout/final payout  separately "Payment Method selected as Pay By Check" at the maturity of the CD account. System must generate checks for Interest and Principal.
Success Criteria: System allows a user to define interest payout instructions and principal payout/final payout  separately at the maturity of the CD account and generates checks at the Maturity.
stepAction:
Precondition
User :  Any    
    
      Customer : Any    
    
      Product : TD/CD    
    
      Lead days for Interest Payment Check is set to 1 at the Product Level    
    
      Account : An account which has maturity date after 3 days on execution of this test script and Account has been set to be set to single maturity    
    
      Screen : TD Renewal Instruction and TD Transaction Inquiry Screen
stepResult: Set Up Step

stepResult: System displays Renewal Instructions

-> Enter "Interest Payment Method" as "Pay By Check" from the drop down under "Interest Renewal Instructions" section.
-> Enter " Maturity Payment Method" as "Pay By Check" from the drop down under "Maturity Renewal Instruction" section.
-> Enter all the remaining mandatory fields.
-> Click on "Submit" button
stepResult: System must capture the instructions for Interest and Principal payment methods on the maturity.

<Day 0>
  
    
Customer Services > Customer Search > Accounts > Inquiry > Transaction Inquiry
stepResult: System displays the Transaction Inquiry Screen

stepAction:

Enter dates in the "From Date" and "To Date"(including the interest check issue date)  -> Click on "Submit" button
stepResult: System must display all the transactions

stepAction: Look for Interest issued check in Transaction History
stepResult: System must has record in transaction history to display that  the check of "Interest Amount" has been issued

stepAction:
Keyword/TD/Access the Transaction Inquiry Screen

  
<Day 0>
  
    
Customer Services > Customer Search > Accounts > Inquiry > Transaction Inquiry
stepResult: System displays the Transaction Inquiry Screen

stepAction:
Enter dates in the "From Date" and "To Date"(including the principal and interest payout date)
      
-> Click on "Submit" button

title: FS-TD-005/PSA-TD-003-089/Verify at the account level penalty calculation is rounding up/Positive
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
System must round up the penalty calculation  decimal places,  ,if  Interest Rounding is set to "Round Up" at the product level.Example: Round Up: Indicates that the number will be rounded up to the required decimal points. For example, if the number is 2.131 and rounding has to be done to two decimal points, the number will be rounded up to 2.14. Likewise, 2.139 will also be rounded up to 2.14. 
Success Criteria: System rounds up the penalty calculation decimal places


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
System must round up the penalty calculation  decimal places,  ,if  Interest Rounding is set to "Round Up" at the product level.Example: Round Up: Indicates that the number will be rounded up to the required decimal points. For example, if the number is 2.131 and rounding has to be done to two decimal points, the number will be rounded up to 2.14. Likewise, 2.139 will also be rounded up to 2.14. 
Success Criteria: System rounds up the penalty calculation decimal places
stepAction:
User :  Any    
    
      Customer : Any    
    
      Product : TD/CD    
    
      At the parameters level "Round Up" is set in the "Interest Rounding".    
    
"Interest Rounding Decimals" is set to 2 at the product level    
    
      Account : Any    
    
      Set the values at the account level in such a way "Penalty Calculation Amount" has values more than 2 decimal places. [for example $4.123]    
    
      Data  - Screen : TD Account Inquiry, Transaction Inquiry Screen & TD Partial Redemption Screen
stepResult: Set Up Step

stepAction:

>Click on Account Inquiry

stepResult: The "Current Balance" and "Available Balance" for the account must be noted.

stepResult: System must allow user to  withdraw the money and must charge the calculated penalty [for example $4.13] .

Go to Transaction Inquiry screen
  
customer--account no--balance
stepResult: Transaction inquiry screen must be displayed

<Day 0>
  
Enter date in "From Date" and in "To Date" [Including the date on which "Partial Redemption " has been performed ]> Click on "Submit" button.
stepResult: System must display all the transactions.

stepAction:
<Day 0>
    
Look for "Penalty Amount" charged transaction record > Verify that the "Penalty  Amount" [Here will be $4.13 as per the value mentioned in step 3]  is rounding up to 2 decimal places.
stepResult: The  "Penalty Amount" [Here must be $4.13 as per the value mentioned in step 3]  must be rounding up to 2 decimal places.

stepAction:
Keyword/TD/Navigate to the TD Account Inquiry Screen

stepResult: System displays account inquiry screen

stepResult: The  "Current Balance" and "Available Balance"  of the account must  decrease by (Withdrawal Amount + Penalty Charged Amount [Here $4.13 after rounding up) .

title: FS-TD-006/PSA-TD-002-030/Single maturity CD that is back dated on renewal must accrue interest from the effective date of renewal.
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
At the account level, when a single maturity CD is renewed and back dated , the system must accrue interest from the effective date of renewal of the CD. 
Success Criteria: System accrues interest from the effective date of renewal for a single maturity CD that has been renewed with a back date.
Note: There is no grace period for single maturity CDs and customer can request for renewal any time after maturity as long as bank allows the renewal.


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
At the account level, when a single maturity CD is renewed and back dated , the system must accrue interest from the effective date of renewal of the CD. 
Success Criteria: System accrues interest from the effective date of renewal for a single maturity CD that has been renewed with a back date.
Note: There is no grace period for single maturity CDs and customer can request for renewal any time after maturity as long as bank allows the renewal.

Customer name: Any
    
Account number : Any
    
User:  Authorized

-CD should be a single maturity CD
-Account must  be matured
    
--The  time is within the duration in which bank allows the renewal.

title: FS-TD-007/3.1.1/Accrued interest adjustment cannot be reduced to a negative value
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
At the account level, when user tries to amend the accrued interest the user inputs the account number and the interest adjustment amount in negative to reduce the accrued interest bucket. In this process system must validate that the interest bucket cannot be reduced to a negative value. 
Success Criteria: System doesn't allow to adjust the accrued interest to a negative value.


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
At the account level, when user tries to amend the accrued interest the user inputs the account number and the interest adjustment amount in negative to reduce the accrued interest bucket. In this process system must validate that the interest bucket cannot be reduced to a negative value. 
Success Criteria: System doesn't allow to adjust the accrued interest to a negative value.
stepAction:
Product: TD/CD
User: Authorized User
Screen:000732: Credit Interest Accrual Adjustment
    
-At the account level
-interest calculation can be simple or compound interest, what ever is defined at the product level.
-the interest capitalization date must be set up
-interest payment date must be set up
-interest must have been credited to the account at an incorrect interest rate.
stepResult: Set up Step

stepAction:
Keyword/TD/Access the Credit Interest Accrual Adjustment Screen

.
Input "account number" and "interest adjustment amount"  in negative to reduce the accrued interest bucket in process of correcting account credit at an incorrect interest rate.
stepResult: The interest bucket must not be reduced to negative value.

stepAction:
Post Condition :
  
NA
stepResult: Clean up step.

title: FS-TD-007/PSA-TD-002-101/System must have the ability to increase available interest bucket
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
At the account level, when it so happens that the interest capitalization is incorrect, system must have the ability to correct an interest payment by creating a credit for the capitalization of interest. 
This must increase the available interest bucket, current balance and interest paid YTD.
User inputs account number and interest adjustment amount. This is done with a interest adjustment credit transaction (006750) and it reduces the "Accrued interest" bucket
Success Criteria: 
System allows the user to correct the interest payment and increases the available interest, current balance and interest paid YTD and credits parameterized P&L account  and also increase the "capitalized unpaid interest"


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
At the account level, when it so happens that the interest capitalization is incorrect system must have the ability to correct an interest payment by creating a credit for the capitalization of interest. 
This must increase the available interest bucket, current balance and interest paid YTD.
User inputs account number and interest adjustment amount.this is done with a interest adjustment credit transaction (006750) and it reduces the "Accrued interest" bucket
Success Criteria: System allows the user to correct the interest payment and increases the available interest, current balance and interest paid YTD and credits parameterized P&L account  and also increase the "capitalized unpaid interest"
stepAction:
Note: Capability level is driven at the transaction level by affiliate.Product: TD/CD
    
User: Authorized User
Screen: Forced Interest Capitalization
    
-At the account level
-interest calculation can be simple or compound interest, what ever is defined at the product level.
-the interest capitalization date must be set up
-interest payment date must be set up
-interest must have been credited to the account at an incorrect interest rate.
stepResult: Set Up Step

stepAction:
<Day 0>Access the Forced Interest Capitalization screen
    
--> Time deposits --> account search --> Transaction -->   Forced Interest Capitalization -->
    
Enter $10.00 in the amount field and other mandatory field > Submit
stepResult: System capitalizes amount of $10.00 in the account

stepAction:

<Day 0> 
    
Click Inquiry from the left navigation panel > Click on Account Inquiry
stepResult: System displays account inquiry screen

stepAction:
<Day 0>

stepResult: Verified the current balance, interest paid YTD and capitalized unpaid interest has been updated/increased by the Amount of $10.00 and Verified "Accrued Interest Bucket" is reduced to "0"

title: FS-TD-011/3.2.2/System must capitalized the interest on maturity irrespective of capitalization frequency/Positive.
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
System must capitalized the interest at the maturity irrespective of capitalization frequency. Use the following example to test this requirement.
Example: Account 
CD term Length - 3 months
Opening Date - Jan 1st
Capitalization – 2 Months
Current Next capitalization date - Feb - 28th
Next capitalization - March, 31st (Not April, 30th because CD matured after 3 months).
Success Criteria: Interest Capitalization takes place at the maturity of CD regardless/ Irrespective of Capitalization Frequency.


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
System must capitalized the interest at the maturity irrespective of capitalization frequency. Use the following example to test this requirement.
Example: Account 
CD term Length - 3 months
Opening Date - Jan 1st
Capitalization – 2 Months
Current Next capitalization date - Feb - 28th
Next capitalization - March, 31st (Not April, 30th because CD matured after 3 months).
Account must be maturing the same day, interest capitalization must be scheduled for later days based on the frequency set.
Success Criteria: Interest Capitalization takes place at the maturity of CD regardless/ Irrespective of Capitalization Frequency.
stepAction:
Pre-Conditions
    
User :  Any
Customer : Any
Product : TD/CD 
Interest  Crediting  frequency is set

CD term Length - 3 months
Opening Date - Jan 1st
Interest Crediting Frequency– 2 Months
Current Next capitalization date - Feb - 28th
Next capitalization - March, 31st (Not April, 30th because CD matured after 3 months). (Modify dates based on the system dates when testing environment is up)
Interest of the previous cycle has already been payed for the CD
      
Account : Any

title: FS-IRA-003/PSA-TD-005-131/CR:34275/Access IRA Screen Summary 2 by IRA Plan description and Financial Year/Positive
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
System must allow a user to access IRA Screen Summary 2 by entering IRA Plan description, financial Year and Inquiry Type at the IRA Screen Summary 1.
Success Criteria: System allows a user to access IRA Screen Summary 2


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
System must allow a user to access IRA Screen Summary 2 by entering IRA Plan description, financial Year and Inquiry Type at the IRA Screen Summary 1.
CR34275:
Due to screen design changes and solutions the account number box needs to be replaced with an inquiry type drop down box on the Account Summary Screen.  This will allow the user to select either a plan summary or provide the summary for that account.
A field will be introduced called Inquiry Type with drop down values of Plan Summary and Account Summary.  With validations when the SSN/TIN is entered the default will be Plan Summary, when no SSN/TIN is entered it will default to Account Summary.
Success Criteria: System allows a user to access IRA Screen Summary 2
stepAction:
Pre Condition:
User :  System    
    Customer : Any    
    Product : IRA    
    Account : Any    
    Screen: IRA Screen Summary 1
stepResult: Set Up Step

stepResult: IRA Summary Screen 1 must be displayed

stepAction:
<Day 0>
      
Enter the Financial Year      
 -> Enter the "IRA Plan Description"
-->Enter Inquiry Type
->Click on "Submit" button
stepResult: System must allow a user to access (Navigate to) IRA Screen Summary 2 by entering the IRA plan description and Inquiry type

stepAction:
Verify that, Due to screen design changes and solutions the account number box needs to be replaced with an inquiry type drop down box on the Account Summary Screen.  This will allow the user to select either a plan summary or provide the summary for that account.
    
A field will be introduced called Inquiry Type with drop down values of Plan Summary and Account Summary.  With validations when the SSN/TIN is entered the default will be Plan Summary, when no SSN/TIN is entered it will default to Account Summary.
stepResult: System should show Inquiry type field successfully

NA

title: FS-IRA-006/3.2.1/Verify Net Pay Amount/Distribution Amount = Partial Redemption Amount - (Penalty + Taxes)/Positive
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
Net pay amount /Distribution amount must be is equal to Redemption/ Requested Amount - (Penalty + Taxes).
For Example:
Available Balance: $9500
Penalty : $10 
State Tax: $2
Fed Tax: $3
Partial Redemption Amount: $1000.00
Success Criteria: Net pay amount /Distribution amount is equal to Redemption/ Requested Amount - (Penalty + Taxes). Distribution Amount will be $985.00


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
Net pay amount /Distribution amount must be is equal to Redemption/ Requested Amount - (Penalty + Taxes).
For Example:
Available Balance: $9500
Penalty : $10 
State Tax: $2
Fed Tax: $3
Partial Redemption Amount: $1000.00
Success Criteria: Net pay amount /Distribution amount is equal to Redemption/ Requested Amount - (Penalty + Taxes). Distribution Amount will be $985.00
stepAction:
User :  Authorized User    
    Customer : Age is less than the 59 and half years  
  
IRA Withdrawal age has been set to 59 1/2 years at the product level
    Product : IRA    
    Account : Any    
    Screen:     IRA TD5 - Partial Distribution, Transaction Inquiry Screen  & IRA  Account Inquiry
stepResult: Set Up Step

Also the "Net Payout Amount [$985 .00 as per example in pre-condition]" must be updated with  Redemption/Requested Amount - (Penalty + Taxes) [ $1000.00 - ( $10 + $2 + $3].

title: FS-IRA-006/3.2.1/Verify New Current Balance = (Current Balance - Partial Redemption Amount) and new Available balance is (Available Balance - Partial Redemption Amount)/Positive
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
New current balance must be Current Balance - Partial Redemption Amount. And New Available Balance must be Available balance - Partial Redemption Amount
For Example:
Current Balance: $10,000.00
Available Balance: $9500.00
Penalty : $10.00
State Tax: $2.00
Fed Tax: $3.00
Partial Redemption Amount: $1000.00
Success Criteria: New Current balance must be $9000.00 (Current Balance - Partial Redemption Amount).
New Available Balance must be $8500.00 (Available Balance - Partial Redemption Amount)


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
New current balance must be Current Balance - Partial Redemption Amount. And New Available Balance must be Available balance - Partial Redemption Amount
For Example:
Current Balance: $10,000.00
Available Balance: $9500.00
Penalty : $10.00
State Tax: $2.00
Fed Tax: $3.00
Partial Redemption Amount: $1000.00
Success Criteria: New Current balance must be $9000.00 (Current Balance - Partial Redemption Amount).
New Available Balance must be $8500.00 (Available Balance - Partial Redemption Amount)

title: FS-IRA-006/PSA-TD-005-178/System must deduct the penalty from the Requested Amount amount/Positive
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
System must deduct the Early withdrawal penalty from the Requested amount. And verify system displays the Penalty Amount, Taxes and Distribution Amount at the Transaction Inquiry Screen.
Success Criteria: System deducts the Early withdrawal penalty from the Requested amount and system displays the Penalty amount, taxes and distribution amount at the Transaction inquiry screen.


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
System must deduct the Early withdrawal penalty from the Requested amount. And verify system displays the Penalty Amount, Taxes and Distribution Amount at the Transaction Inquiry Screen.
Success Criteria: System deducts the Early withdrawal penalty from the Requested amount and system displays the Penalty amount, taxes and distribution amount at the Transaction inquiry screen.
stepAction:
User :  Authorized User      
      Customer : Age is less than the 59 and half years    
    
IRA Withdrawal age has been set to 59 1/2 years at the product level
      Product : IRA      
      Account : Any      
      Screen:       IRA TD5 - Partial Distribution Screen    
    
      Penalty Calculation method has been set at the Parameter level    
    
      Penalty routine code has been linked to the account.    
    
Example:
    
Gross (requested) amt = 2000
    
Available Int = 26.48
    
Penalty amount = 8.89 (penalty amt calc on gross amt - avl Int)
    
Fed Taxes = 199.11 (tax cal on gross amount - penalty)
    
Check / transfer dist. amount = 1792 (final dist. calc, gross - penalty - taxes)
stepResult: Set Up Step.

stepAction:
Keyword/IRA/Access the IRA TD5 Partial Distribution Screen

  
Navigate to IRA CD partial distribution
  
operations --> IRA --> customer search --> transactions --> IRA CD partial distribution
stepResult: IRA CD Partial Distribution screen must be displayed

stepAction: Select value in field "Distribution Types", "Amount Requested  [$2000 as per precondition, less than the available balance in the account]" -> Go to "Distribution Details" section -> Enter     'I Federal Tax [199.11, as per precondition example] -> Select  "Waive Penalty" field value as "No".
stepResult: The" Waive Penalty" field value must be "No" . The requested amount must be less than the "Available Amount[2000 as per precondition]".  The IRA Early withdrawal Penalty [$8.89 as per pre-condition] must be deducted from the distribution amount and must display  [1792, as per precondition]"and other values on the screen must be updated on the basis of "Penalty calculation method" selected at Parameter Level.

stepAction: <Day 0> Enter other mandatory details  -> Click on "Submit" button.
stepResult: The system must allow user to partially withdraw the available balance and charge the penalty as the customer age is less than the 591/2. also must deduct the  penalty form distribution amount.

Also has record  to show that the "Penalty amount"[8.89], "Taxes"[199.11] and  has been deducted from the Distribution Amount  and must display distribution amount  [$1792 as per pre-condition].

title: FS-IRA-008/PSA-TD-005-015/Ability to renew an IRA account for same term length and new interest rate (Product rate)/Positive
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
System must have the ability to renew the IRA account for same term length (created during Account Opening) and new interest rate from the product level rate table on the maturity date of the account. Explanation: New interest rate from the Product level will be inherited at the Account Level at the time of renewal. Effective interest rate at the account level must same as at the product level.
Success Criteria: System renews the IRA account in same term length and new interest rate (Product Rate)


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
System must have the ability to renew the IRA account for same term length (created during Account Opening) and new interest rate from the product level rate table on the maturity date of the account. Explanation: New interest rate from the Product level will be inherited at the Account Level at the time of renewal. Effective interest rate at the account level must same as at the product level.
Success Criteria: System renews the IRA account in same term length and new interest rate (Product Rate)

User :  System

      Product : IRA      
      Account : ANy

      Term length has been set at the account level during account opening    
    
      Interest Rate changed at the Product Level after the account creation

title: FS-IRA-008/PSA-TD-005-121/Verify the Interest Payment method is inherited at the account level that captured at the product level and user is not able to change it at the account level-Account Create/Positive
description:
RTC Test Case Description:
  
  
System must have the ability to inherit the Interest Payment Method that has been set at the product level. And system must not allow a user to change the interest payment method at the account level during account opening if At the product level (Parameter User) sets Interest Payment Method as R:Reinvest = Capitalize
Success Criteria: System inherited the Interest Payment Method at the Account Level from the Product Level and system does not allow a user to change the interest payment method at the account level.


  
    RTC Test Suite Description:
  
  
System must have the ability to inherit the Interest Payment Method that has been set at the product level. And system must not allow a user to change the interest payment method at the account level during account opening if At the product level (Parameter User) sets Interest Payment Method as R:Reinvest = Capitalize
Success Criteria: System inherited the Interest Payment Method at the Account Level from the Product Level and system does not allow a user to change the interest payment method at the account level.

User :  System    
    
      Customer : Any      
      Product : IRA      
      Account : Any
